elements.title: Wie liegt die Stadt so wüst
elements.contents: ... that Wie liegt die Stadt so wüst (How Deserted Lies the City), a motet composed by Rudolf Mauersberger after the bombing of Dresden, was first performed in the destroyed Kreuzkirche (pictured)?

elements.title: Carl Segerståhl
elements.contents: ... that instead of paying homage to a visiting King Gustaf VI Adolf, Swedish headmaster Carl Segerståhl took his students swimming in a nearby lake?

elements.title: LGBT coverage on the site
elements.contents: ... that Wikipedia editors have organized various campaigns to improve LGBT coverage on the site?

elements.title: Olipop
elements.contents: ... that Olipop, with more than $100 million in revenue, has an all-remote workforce?

elements.title: UNICEF club
elements.contents: ... that Illinois senator Mark Kirk returned to his former high school as an adult to create a UNICEF club?

elements.title: the 2024 season
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 season for Seattle Sounders FC will be their first with a new logo?

elements.title: Letterpress
elements.contents: ... that while developing the sound effects for Letterpress, Loren Brichter spit in his microphone?

elements.title: Line 51
elements.contents: ... that Line 51 of the Amsterdam Metro was called an express tram because the term "metro" was too controversial in the city?
